name: Alain Ducasse
description: Alain Ducasse is a French-born Monégasque chef. He operates a number of restaurants including Alain Ducasse at The Dorchester which holds three stars (the top rating) in the Michelin Guide

recipes.name: Alain Ducasse
ingradient: Fish and shellfish such as red mullet, gurnard, sea bream, and prawns
Vegetables such as onion, leek, fennel, and tomato
Aromatics such as garlic, thyme, bay leaf, and orange peel
Fish stock and white wine
Rouille made with garlic, egg yolks, breadcrumbs, and olive oil
recipes.cookingMethod: To make Soupe de poissons according to Alain Ducasse's recipe, you would first clean and prepare the fish and shellfish, removing the heads, bones, and shells. In a large pot or Dutch oven, you would sauté chopped onion, leek, and fennel in olive oil until softened, then add garlic, tomato, thyme, bay leaf, and orange peel and cook for another few minutes. Next, you would add fish stock and white wine to the pot and bring to a simmer. Finally, you would add the fish and shellfish to the pot and cook until done. The soup is traditionally served with rouille, a garlicky mayonnaise-like condiment.
